utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: If you testify, no one can protect you. Especially the Feds.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: We’ll keep you safe, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Right. Witness Protection. This great new life he’s giving you? You’re sacking groceries at some goat-town Stop and Shop when one of the Talli guys comes up and puts two in the back of your skull.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: Counselor, are you advising a witness to withhold evidence from a federal grand jury?

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: He came forward; he volunteered. I’m advising him not to testify until I’m satisfied you can protect him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, you guys mind? I got money on this.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: What do you want? We gave you everything you asked for.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I asked for pasta.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: You got steak, enjoy it.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: What are you doing? Where’s your quit candy? I just gave you a pack.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry, I forgot.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Joey, whatever they give us, what they tell you, you get popped, what am I going to do? Sue them?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not what this is about. You’re gonna miss me.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I’m your lawyer, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re my brother. And I do this, you know, go into Witness Protection, we’re never gonna see each other again.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: That doesn’t bother you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Kills me. Hey, I gotta take a leak.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, just, uh, little dizzy…

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Get some air.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And hot.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: What did you say to him?

utterance.speaker: Brady
utterance.content: Yeah, nice try.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Let go of me! Let go of me, can’t you see he’s sick?

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: Joey! Joey!

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Something’s wrong with him!

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: Come on, you’re not getting out of this that easy! Either you’re dead, or you’re testifying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Don’t have it.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Budget?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Revenue statement, list of expenses…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House has been very busy.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Saving New Jersey from leprosy, yes, I know. Getting me his numbers, that’s your job.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We’re in a meeting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Need the lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Who’d you kill?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nobody, but it’s not even lunch. Got served with a federal court order. Some witness went into a coma and they want me to take a look at it.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: What? They want you to examine a sick person? This is a public relations nightmare. Don’t think our staff do that kind of thing around here… this place would be crawling with sick people!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m a doctor, I’m not a lapdog for the feds; I don’t play fetch.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Nobody tells you what to do. Am I right, Dr. Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have three choices: hire a lawyer to fight the order, treat the guy, or go to jail for contempt. Up to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Jail. You’d like that. No more naughty schoolgirl. Conjugal visit, that’s her new fantasy.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: We’re not leaving until he’s gone or you show me one good reason for keeping him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s really out of it, huh?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Causes of coma: metabolic, structural –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He had his stomach pumped! Why would they do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rule out poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Huh. Not the typical first guess.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, the first guess was faking it. Patient’s a federal witness, reluctant, I’m assuming. He’s also an 8 on the Glasgow coma scale.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That’s barely alive. Pretty tough to fake it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Any recent history of head trauma? Bad car accident, fall?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They tell me no, but do an MRI to be sure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Metabolic causes. Liver, kidney, diabetes –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check for everything, feds are paying. We’re gonna turn a profit on this one, boys.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Dr. House, Bill Arnello. I’m a lawyer, I represent Mr. Smith. What’s wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do I come to you with my problems?

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: He’s also my brother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, you changed your name? “Smith” wasn’t good enough for you?

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: His name’s Joey, he’s my only brother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s important to you, got it. So, no placebos for him, we’ll use the real medicine. Well, this was fun, let’s do it again soon. Brother in the Mafia? So, just Joey? I was hoping for a nickname. Joey Mango. Joey the Wrench. People know where I am.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I want you to do your job. Diagnose him, fix him, and keep him here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We’re a bit of a specialized hospital. We generally only deal with patients when they’re actually sick.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: If you release my brother to the government, and he does what they want, even if you fix him, he’s dead. I need time to convince him of that. Good news is, if you screw up you don’t have to worry about a malpractice suit. If he’s dead, one by one, I’ll take away the things you love ‘till there’s nothing left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, on the Mafia thing, that’s a yes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did House seem weird to you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you expecting him to be weird?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We spoke about how we felt.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You told him you liked him?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you talking about, then?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I asked him if he liked me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Because I like him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You like him, like him?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter, he doesn’t like me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey, he doesn’t like anybody. And nobody likes him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: MRI showed a subdural hematoma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bleeding around his brain caused pressure inside his head which caused the coma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: These look like pseudomembranes. Those take time to form. If it was an old injury it wouldn’t have caused the coma.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Patient history indicates he was hit with a tire iron in 1996. Brother says he was changing a tire and it slipped.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Subdural hematoma placed where this one is, it could have caused his coma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about his liver?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: LFTs are slightly elevated.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Key word is slightly. As in, not high enough to cause the coma. It’s the subdural.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I say we evacuate the cavity, see if he wakes up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The neurologist thinks it’s his brain, wants to open up his head. Frankly, I’m shocked! You get to use the big boy drill and Daddy’s big red toolbox.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No drilling. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mr. Smith!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Call me Joe. Can you not do that? So, we’re clear about the no drilling?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s okay now, he can leave.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m not releasing him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because the brother doesn’t want you to?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or because he had an unexplained coma, which sounds better?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The hematoma caused the coma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s a catchy diagnosis, you could dance to that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I think Chase is right. It still should be evacuated, but it’s not an immediate threat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameron’s my girl.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’d release him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you disagreeing with me because –

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m disagreeing because that’s my medical opinion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course it is. But unless I’ve been named as the fourth part of the Axis of Evil, invaded and occupied, this is still not a democracy. He’s staying. Send for Hepatitis serologies and an autoimmune panel.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey. I’m with you. Old enough to drink, old enough to do something really stupid and make yourself a baby.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: He’s my brother. I’m watching him while my parents are in Barbados. He’s having trouble breathing and there’s a lot of wheezing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whistling, technically. Upper airways, nose.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: If he’s got the croup, that could become meningitis, right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I was just studying and all of a sudden I hear him crying and sounding all weird. My parents are going to kill me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I doubt it.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: You don’t know them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I doubt you were studying while your parents were away. Hello, officer. You might want to rinse this off before you let him play with it again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What happened? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Vogler called admitting, admitting called Justice, Justice came and took him away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And who called Vogler?

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: He loses money.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So does ophthalmology. Who cares, this is a hospital. You can’t just cut a department!

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: You can’t control him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I am the only one that can control him.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: D-D-D-D-Dr. House in the House! Impeccable timing as always.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You had no authority to release my patient.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: My colleague has just informed me that she has a singular talent. You are just in time for a demonstration.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dr. House, from what I understand, your –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: From what you understand? He’s not your patient; how the hell do you understand anything?

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: That’s sad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re not even a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: John Smith is here only because of court order. I had the records faxed to the judge; she rescinded the order.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why bother, just to piss me off?

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Keeping the government off our ass. Hmm. Yeah. That makes no sense for a public institution.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, sir. Carry on.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He really cares about his patients.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Yeah, and he just walked out of here with nothing. Something’s up.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: He just started vomiting and passed out

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: 35-year-old male, vital signs are stable now. Gave him 2 liters en route. Just released from here two hours ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, your junior G-man badge isn’t looking so good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His liver’s worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Comatose?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, completely different symptoms than the first time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Serology tests came back positive for Hep-C.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hep-C is a chronic condition. You don’t think this is an acute situation?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Coma, vomiting, abdominal pain, Hep-C explains everything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Except for the suddenness of the onset.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What’s wrong with the timing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You get home one night. Your wife hits you with a baseball bat. Likely cause is the fact you haven’t thanked her for dinner in eight years, or the receipt for fur handcuffs she found in your pants. Sudden onset equals proximate cause.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He also has high estrogen levels in his blood. That’s indicative of a chronic condition, not acute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One test. What do his other liver tests tell us?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Normal albumin levels point toward acute.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Uh-huh. And why is her test better than mine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because she’s cuter. Though it’s close. Do a liver biopsy. When the results come back we’ll know what we’re looking at.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why wait to treat the Hep-C? If I’m right, Joey gets better that much faster.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. Then he gets to testify, and you get a gold star from Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then what’s the downside? Or is that the downside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do I have a reason for not wanting you to get any stars? Fine, start the treatment. It’s all your idea. Don’t even mention my name. There’s nothing wrong with your theory, go. But in the “humor me” department, get a biopsy while you’re at it. Foreman, we need to talk. You’re off the case.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Somebody told Vogler that I lied to the transplant committee.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You think I did?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re too careful. You wouldn’t jump ship unless you knew what was in the water.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stop, you’re embarrassing me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But I want Vogler to think I think it’s you. And I want Cameron and Chase and Cuddy and Wilson and the nursing staff and the cashier in the parking lot to think that, too.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The blood tests show you have Hepatitis C. It’s a virus that infects the liver.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, it’s not all bad news. It can often be cured, and even if not, it’s manageable.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: How’d my brother get this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Usually it involves the exchange of bodily fluids, the, uh –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Bodily fluids, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There are many ways the virus can be transmitted. Sharing needles, blood transfusions –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Hey! Nobody talks to my brother like this, okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fine. I’ve no idea how he got it. But he has Hepatitis-C. We’re going to start him on Interferon –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: He doesn’t have it, don’t mention it again, don’t treat him for it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House has some directed donations, foundation support… It’s around here…

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: He makes you miserable. Eight years he’s worked here, never made a dime for you, never listened to you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He can change, he’s –

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: He hasn’t changed in eight years. Either he can’t change, or you can’t change him. You have no idea how many times he’s lied to you, undercut your authority, made you look like crap to other doctors.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes, I hate him, and here I am, desperately trying to protect his job. What does that tell you?

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: That you don’t hate him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I do not protect people I like. I protect people who are assets to this hospital.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: No. That’s me. You, you’re softer.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Right. There are three female Chiefs of Medicine at major hospitals in this country and we all got there using our feminine wiles.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: It’s human nature to wanna protect people we like.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don’t like him!

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: We think if we can just form the right team, we’ll all get along, be able to pull the boat –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don’t get along with him!

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Well, this is not a team, it’s not a boat, it’s not a machine that has a lot of parts that have to work together. The metaphors are all crap. This is a business. That’s all it is. You like him, that’s bad for business.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Ah, this is all my fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Took another homework break with Betty Lou?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, last week I showed him a magic trick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pulled a quarter out of his nose. It’s a classic.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah, now he won’t stop shoving stuff up there.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got a crisis here!

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Stop!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s a neat trick.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You have to believe you’ll actually hurt them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Your people insulted my brother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, they put romano in the parmesan cheese shaker again?

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Said he was a crackhead or a homo or something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Those idiots. How many times am I going to have to send them through sensitivity training? Nobody’s saying he’s a homo, that would be really, really bad. So let’s put a nice, friendly spin on it. Let’s go with: he got raped in prison. I saw the jailhouse tats, put it together with the blood tests…

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: There were rumors, but Joey never said anything about…. If people find out he’s being treated for Hep-C? Feds get that chart, someone says something to somebody, word’ll get out. And then Joey’s manhood, his rep is destroyed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re worried about how his coworkers will react in the Walmart in Des Moines.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: He’s not going into Witness Protection, I won’t let that happen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Listen, I don’t know if you know about this, but mob businesses sometimes keep two sets of books.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: One legit, one not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You jerking my chain?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doctors are busy, sometimes they forget to write things down, it happens all the time.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Thanks. Oh, and whatever you’re not giving him for whatever he doesn’t have, is that going to fix him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I doubt it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On your way to polish Vogler’s car?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Gone are the days of the grumpy old doc seeing patients in the basement of his house, getting paid a few chickens.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How will I eat?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know what Cuddy has been locked in with Vogler about all day today, and yesterday?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Floor polish costs through the roof?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You. Her secretary’s been to the photocopier all day with your records. It’s all they’re looking at in there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My car has been stolen.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Or rein-CAR-nated. Pink slip. “A gift from the Arnello brothers.”

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, they’re gangsters, sure, but they’re thoughtful, too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You can’t keep it. It’s graft.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. Uh-uh. Graft is if I tell them I’ll only make him better if he slips me a couple bucks. A payoff for something I’m not supposed to do. If I’d asked for the payoff , I would have done the bad thing anyway. So there’s nothing wrong with this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn. ’65. Perfectly restored. What do you think a guy like Joey would do if someone turned down a gift? That’s kind of an insult, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He might hurt you. It’s definitely possible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m screwed. Gotta take the car.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did you see House’s new car?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Joey. He obviously can’t keep it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You don’t mind the hospital taking money from Vogler?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That’s different, Vogler’s legit.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That’s worse. Vogler’s money came with strings.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Vogler doesn’t set me up to have a mobster take a swing at me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m sure House didn’t know –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Joey’s pressure dropped. Pushed IV fluids, now he’s holding 100 systolic.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Septic?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, looks like he’s bleeding into his liver.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Varices. You see it with chronic Hep-C all the time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Biopsy’s back. Two findings. Number one: lymphocytic infiltrate and no bridging fibrosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well, whatever’s killing him is not Hep-C. It’s acute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who said that? I forget. What are you doing here? I told you you were off the case.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Right. Your diabolic plan to convince the evil genius he’s in the clear so he’ll let his guard down and make a fatal mistake, sure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, it’s clearly not going to work now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What evil genius?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we knew that, then we wouldn’t need a diabolic plan now, would we?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House thinks someone ratted him out to Vogler.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, what? One of us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you guys love me too much.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: All right, look, if it’s not the Hep-C, then what’s the problem? What’s causing the liver failure?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Finding number two: toxins.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No. He’s only 30 years old and his job doesn’t expose him to heavy metals or environmental –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s a 30-year-old mobster. He doesn’t have a job that results in accidental exposure to toxins, he has a job that results in intentional exposure to toxins. Someone’s poisoned him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever this toxin is, it’s doing its job and fast. How long do we have until the next round of test results?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: About four hours.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Too bad his liver’s only going to last another two.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We’re going to have to get him a new one.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What, in two hours?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There is another way. Relax, it’s kosher.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: This is so bizarre.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not really. We just take the blood out of Joey’s body and run it through a pig. The pig’s liver does what Joey’s can’t, cleans the blood, which we send right back to him.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: And the pig makes him better?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, just buys us some time to figure out what’s poisoning your brother.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Like you do this all the time?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, we’ve basically got a barn in the basement.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Cross off hemlock.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You thought he was being poisoned by hemlock? Dr. Euripides tell you to check for that?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Grows wild by the highways out here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How much do you like House?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Chase has a big mouth.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. He's probably the one who ratted to Vogler.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don't think that he would --

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Does it hurt when you're with House? Little pain in the tummy, but it sort of feels good, too?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don't have the right to show interest in someone?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You absolutely do, and I absolutely have the right to humiliate you for it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: White blood count's low; probably a result of the illness, nothing to connect to the liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is he a smoker?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Let me check.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Early signs of emphysema. He's been smoking at least a dozen years.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: 18. You got that from the white count?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, got that from the chest x-ray. White count just tells me he's quitting.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How’s your tummy?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Flat and taut.

utterance.speaker: Brady
utterance.content: I’ve been on the job for 12 years.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: You put $3,000 in your wife’s checking account this morning. I want to know where it came from.

utterance.speaker: Brady
utterance.content: I got a perfect record.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: Where did you get the money.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cancel the thumb screws, I’ve got our culprit.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not who, Hu.

utterance.speaker: Everhardt
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks for playing along. Chai Hu, a Chinese herb in his quit smoking candy. Reduces cravings, also reduces his white blood count. Oh yeah, he also took enough of them to poison himself. We’ll keep him on the pig for a few more hours, then take him off the candy, he’ll be fine. Pig won’t be. Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Hey, you feeling better?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Famished.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I think they’ve got fish sticks on the menu.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Makes me miss prison.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So, the mobster’s good to go?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ll keep him overnight, then let the feds know he’s good to rat out whoever he wants.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Brother won’t be happy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe have to give back the car.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You should let Vogler tell the feds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because it matters to him. Because you humiliated him the first time Joey was released. You think you should still be in third there, ace?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He humiliated himself.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And because your job depends on the kind of mood Vogler’s in at the end of his marathon with Cuddy. Seriously, man, have you ever driven an automobile before? There are four gears, you know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The ’66 came with a Shut Up button.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It is my medical opinion that the patient is healthy and can be released.

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Thanks for letting us know. Give me the U.S. Attorney’s office.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I see you’ve found out what we’re meeting about.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re having a meeting?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, whatever the reason, the coat looks good on you. Chai Hu lozenges cause this kind of liver failure, no way!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not by themselves, but in combination with the Interferon it’s like gas to a flame.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What Interferon?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For the Hep-C.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What Hep-C?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is hiding a mobster’s Hep-C that important?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is letting the feds know everything that important?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You know, you are a piece of work, even now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ed!

utterance.speaker: Vogler
utterance.content: Edward.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Joey’s back in a coma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s stable, but comatose.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Worse than before, he’s on a ventilator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Question is, why? It’s not his brain, it’s not a toxin. Our friend Babe helped with that one. So what else?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The Hep-C. We never really treated it, we stopped the Interferon when it started poisoning his liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Am I going to have to write a song about it? His chronic Hep-C was not bad enough to produce these symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The estrogen level indicates it is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Indicates something else entirely.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We can’t give him Interferon now. There’s still traces of the lozenges in his system. It’ll just poison him again,

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Genetics. We don’t just treat the virus, we change it. A non-nucleoside allosteric inhibitor.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s never been tried on a human being. It could kill him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, what’s the difference? He’s dead without it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They’re running a trial on dogs at St. Sebastian’s in Philadelphia. I’ll make the call.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What else could cause his estrogen level to be that high?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We’re going to put the medicine here. We don’t want it to burn his veins when it goes in.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You have no idea if it will work.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’s shown promise in testing.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Maybe there’s nothing up there, I watched him like a hawk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty sure you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I didn’t let him play with any more little toys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thus forcing him to shove a big one up there. Stop or I snap your nose off!

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: He’s not too smart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Genetics is a powerful force. On the other hand, maybe he’s smarter than you think.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just give me a second. Always wanted to use one of these. Tilt his head back.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just tilt his head back. Nice grasp of concepts, relationships. Very smart, very cool. First the policeman, fireman, fire truck. Your brother was sending in teams to save the cat.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sometimes the simplest answer…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Most types of coma you just don’t snap out of.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s not snapping out of this one, he’s not improving. You crossed out estrogen, you’ve got an explanation?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, I have. A very simple one.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s private.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think I’m the one running to Vogler.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re currently top of the list. Toxic comas, person’s away from the cause long enough and they recover.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The feds checked for poisons, we checked for poisons. I didn’t do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not a poison, then.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: An allergy, then. Did you hear me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How about a food sensitivity?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: All of his food is strictly controlled. There’s no correlation between his meals and his condition. He had steak and potatoes before the first coma, and the hospital served fish sticks before the second one. You can trust me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Problem is, if I can’t trust you, I can’t trust your statement that I can trust you. But thanks anyway, you’ve been a big help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So where did you get the money?

utterance.speaker: Brady
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone paid you off.

utterance.speaker: Brady
utterance.content: What are you talking about? It wasn’t poison, you told us that it –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re talking about poison. I’m talking about payoff. Graft.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Leave him alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You paid the marshal off.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I didn’t pay him to poison my brother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it just worked out that way.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I gave the guy some money to get him some decent food.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better than fish sticks? I’m thinking steak.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: We asked for pasta. Those stupid feds could care less –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He had steak before both comas. Your brother has Ornithine Transcarbamylase Deficiency. You want me to write it down? Good, because it takes a while. It’s genetic, it can present at any time. The patient eats a large amount of protein, especially if he’s not used to it.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: That’s it? He stays off the red meat and he’s going to be fine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. If I’m right, and we stop the current treatment, he gets better. If we stop the current treatment and I’m wrong, he dies.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Why would you be wrong?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His estrogen level. OTD doesn’t explain his estrogen level. But I have a theory. There is one chemical that, if ingested, can cause a person’s estrogen level to increase dramatically.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s called estrogen.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Joey’s taking estrogen? What, he wants a sex change?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, nothing like that. It’s called Male Flame. It’s probably more consumer friendly in the original Chinese. It’s an herbal aphrodisiac marketed to gay men.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Oh, here we go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And sold on the same website that sells his Chai Hu lozenges. Guess what’s in it? Starts with an “e”.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You want to get hit, too?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would be quite a trick. “He slapped me so hard his brother turned straight.” Joey’s a big-time mobster. Guys like that don’t get raped in prison. They get gifts, they get food, drugs, cigarettes, cable TV…

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Joey is not gay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, maybe not gay, but certainly delightful. You, on the other hand, hitting a doctor, even if it was only Chase… and asking another one to keep his chart fresh and homo-free. Well, that’s a bit of an overreaction, wouldn’t you say? It’s almost like you’re scared that it might be true.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You’re wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Then don’t stop the treatment. But if you’re wrong, he dies.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Okay. He never said anything to me about it, not once.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s what I love about you mob guys: so tolerant of others, so accepting. Only way he was coming out was way, way out. Lose the tattoos, change his name, move to another town… how’s a guy like him going to do that? Witness protection. It’s not just for witnesses any more.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You can go in now, sit with him if you want.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: How much longer?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s only been three hours. If it’s the OTD –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: If it’s the OTD? What if House is wrong, huh?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That severe a reaction, it’ll take some time –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: He makes assumptions about people, talks you into things.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Mr. Arnello. He’s awake. He wants to see you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You look like crap. That’s a joke, see. I’m sick, I said you look like crap –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You have no idea what I just went through out there. You kept getting worse, and Dr. House kept saying all this crap. If I think you’re normal, then he’s going to keep giving you the medicine, and if you weren’t…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Weren’t what? Normal?

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Yeah. He said you were a fag. Witness protection, that’s your big chance to be one.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You believe him?

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I don’t know what to believe. You were sick. I had to make a decision. I thought you were gonna die.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You believed him. He stopped the medicine. Here I am. I wanted to talk to you about this –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: There’s nothing to talk about. You, uh, ordered some Chinese internet health crap, they sent the wrong pills, you took ‘em.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, that, uh, that must be it.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: You want to testify, go ahead. I told the doc, he said it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t expect you to understand –

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I don’t. All I need to know is you’re my brother, Joey. If you think this thing, whatever, is going to make you happy, I think you should do it. You should.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Vogler wants to fire you. Lose the whole department.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good thing you fought for me, though, right? The dress was a nice move, but you’ve got to follow it up. Nasty weekend in Vegas, something that shows off your real administrative skills.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He threatened to fire me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m sorry. So, how long do I have? I’ve a lot of personal stuff to pack up. I assume you’re going to want to throw a party.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I told him I know where the bodies are buried, the stuff he needs to know that’s not in the books. Told him he can’t ditch me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s only keeping you on because you know the secret handshakes. He’s a quick study. Six months, he’ll have the moves down. Then he won’t need you any more.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’ll deal with that then.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So I stay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes. But some things are going to change.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Profits. New world order.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Everything’s about profits.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s real new. You could rent out the Corvette every once in a while, or lend it to a friend.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would be easy, and it would be wrong.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But Cuddy stood up for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To a point.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: To what point?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I gotta do six more clinic hours a month. So do two of them.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why only two?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ‘Cause one of them’s gone. I gotta fire somebody. Good morning.
